newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Hilti sees sharp rise in operating profit.
newsitem.headline: Hilti sees sharp rise in operating profit.

text.p: Specialty construction equipment maker Hilti AG said it expected a double-digit rise in operating 1997 profit and net profit at or slightly above the 1996 level of 204.2 million Swiss francs.
"We expect double-digit growth in operating results," chief executive Pius Baschera told reporters ahead of the annual news conference.
He said operating and net profit this year would be boosted by more favourable exchange rates than in the prior year and by reorganisation paid for from 1996 accounts.
Baschera said it was too early to make a detailed forecast for net profit for 1997.
"That depends on a lot of things, including operating results and developments in financial markets," he said.
"We expect to maintain the previous year's levels or exceed it slightly," he said about 1997 net profit. -- Zurich Editorial +41 631 7340
